com.jeefo.android.log

Class ScopedLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jeefo.android.log.ScopedLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILog, java.io.Serializable

    public class ScopedLogger
extends java.lang.Object
implements ILog
    Created by Alexandru Iustin Dochioiu on 13/12/17. Concurrent logger used for creating a pass-through trace which will improve drastically the readability of the logged messages as well as decrease the debugging time when bugs/ crashes arise. For ease of use, the messages contain placeholders ('%s') and String params which will replace them. It logs all the messages to Logcat as well as to a persistent file (if activated).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScopedLogger

        public ScopedLogger(@NonNull
                    java.lang.Class classCaller)
        Constructor used for initializing a completely new ScopedLogger which will (ideally) be used in creating further ScopedLoggers with extended trace. NOTE: This constructor adds the instance tag. if this is undesired, use the following constructor: ScopedLogger(@NonNull Class classCaller, boolean addInstanceUidTag) and set the second param to false
        Parameters:
        classCaller - the Class in which this log is created

      • ScopedLogger

        public ScopedLogger(@NonNull
                    java.lang.Class classCaller,
                    boolean addInstanceUidTag)
        Constructor used for initializing a completely new ScopedLogger which will (ideally) be used in creating further ScopedLoggers with extended trace
        Parameters:
        classCaller - the Class in which this log is created
        addInstanceUidTag - used for telling whether an instance tag should be added to this logger

      • ScopedLogger

        public ScopedLogger(@Nullable
                    ILog logger,
                    @NonNull
                    java.lang.Class classCaller,
                    boolean addInstanceUidTag)
        Constructor used for initializing a completely new ScopedLogger for a class OR for extending the trace of an existent ILog
        Parameters:
        logger - the ILog to which we extend the tags trace OR NULL to create a new ScopedLogger
        classCaller - the Class in which this log is created
        addInstanceUidTag - used for telling whether an instance tag should be added to this logger

      • ScopedLogger

        public ScopedLogger(@Nullable
                    ILog logger,
                    @NonNull
                    java.lang.Class classCaller,
                    @Nullable
                    java.lang.String method)
        Constructor used for creating a ScopedLogger with both class and method tags

        INTENDED USAGE: When creating a logger based on an ILog passed as a parameter (especially applicable to static methods)

        ALTERNATIVE USAGE: When creating a completely new logger (not extending from an existent one) inside a method which is to be used only in the scope of that method. -- note: I generally believe that this is not good practice, and that the previous logger should be passed as a param and used

        Parameters:
        logger - the ILog to which we extend the tags trace OR NULL to create a new ScopedLogger
        classCaller - the Class in which this log is created
        method - the String containing the method name (ignored if null or empty)

      • ScopedLogger

        public ScopedLogger(@NonNull
                    ILog logger,
                    @NonNull
                    java.lang.String method)
        Constructor used for adding a method tag to an existent ILog.

        NOTE: The created ILog should exist only within the scope of a method (or passed on further calls made within that method)! (IT SHOULD NEVER BE STORED AS A MEMBER)

        USAGE: This was intended for the scenario in which a class stores an ILog as a member. At the beginning of a method call, we use the member logger to create a new ILog methodLogger = new ScopedLogger(memberLogger, "onMethodAction()"); This new logger will exist only in the scope of this method, and should not be stored elsewhere.

        Parameters:
        logger - the ILog used for the log trace
        method - the String containing the method name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when either of the parameters is null or method is empty string
